hook.text: A single dose of psilocybin reduced depression symptoms for months in clinical trials. Psychedelics are back.

buildup.text: Psychedelics like psilocybin and MDMA increase neural connectivity, allowing rigid brain patterns to break.

twist.text: These drugs were banned in the 1970s due to politics, not science. Decades of research were lost.

climax.text: FDA-approved psychedelic therapy may arrive within years for PTSD, depression, and end-of-life anxiety.

punchline.text: Banned for decades, now prescribed for healing.

quiz.question: How do psychedelics affect the brain's default mode network?
options: They temporarily dissolve it, breaking rigid thought patterns
